context_of_use: This use case allows managers to review and approve pending orders in the system to ensure timely processing.
stakeholders_and_interests: manager: Ensure timely approval of orders to avoid delays in business processes.
description: This use case enables managers to approve pending orders, facilitating efficient business operations.
triggering_event: Manager initiates the order approval process.
preconditions: The manager is logged into the system.
There are pending orders awaiting approval.
postconditions: The selected orders are approved and updated in the system.
assumptions: The manager has the necessary permissions to approve orders.
requirements_met: The system shall allow managers to approve orders to prevent delays in business processes.
outstanding_issues: Clarification on the criteria for order approval.
main_flow: 1. Manager selects pending orders → System displays the list of pending orders.
2. Manager reviews order details → System shows detailed information for the selected order.
3. Manager approves the order → System updates the order status to approved.
alternative_flows: AF-1 (from Step 2): If the manager finds issues with the order, they can reject the order, and the system updates the order status to rejected.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 1): If there are no pending orders, the system displays a message indicating no orders are available for approval.
